item.title: Report E-2024090093
item.description:
Report E-2024090093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-20ft area of the trailer floor and a 1ft-by-1ft area of concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that eight (8) gallons of material was released. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage, deployed absorbents, and then cleaned the released material. The damaged cardboard, containers, and recovered material was placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
